moreInfo.schedule:
Friday 12/16/22

2:00pm â€“ 4:00pm Practice Session

4:00pm - Optional Sweeper

Saturday 12/17/22

8:30am â€“ Roll Call

9:00am â€“ A Squad (8 games)

1:3 teams will cash

Cut to top 12 teams

5:00 - Pro-Am

Sunday 12/18/22

9:00am â€“ Round Robin Match Play (12 games)
moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
REMINDER: PBA Members receive priority entry. If a member is on the waiting list as of the entry deadline they will be placed on the roster and a guest may be bumped. As a doubles event, priority order will be as follows: Member/Member, Member/Guest, Guest Guest.

Participant must be a USBC Member in good standing. 
***PLEASE READ***:
A list of product registered companies is listed on PBA.com: https://www.pba.com/ProductRegistration/Manufacturers
Apparel: (dye sublimated jerseys) Only jerseys from product registered companies will be allowed (all levels of PBA competition). Regular type shirts with name on the back have no brand restrictions.

Entry Fee
Per person

Members: $245
Non-Members: $310 (money order, cashierâ€™s check or credit card only)

Payout Ratio - 1:3 teams

Entry Deadline
Online entries for members and non-members close at midnight on Monday, December 12th.
After the deadline, entries must be made directly with the PBA Southwest Region Manager.


High Game
High game pot will be available for $45 and covers all 8 games.
Separate high game pot for Seniors.


Additional Info
This will be a doubles tournament. Each team must have at least one player age 50 or over. Teams may be 2 members, 2 non-members, or one member/one non-member.

This event will count for points for the 2023 proposed PBA Southwest Region FireLake Invitational and 2023 RPI points list.
moreInfo.prizeFund:
Proposed payout

1st- $7000 per team
Last cash - $800 per team

title: PBA/PBA50 Select Key Motors Bristol Baker Doubles

hostCenter.name: Interstate Lanes
hostCenter.address: 3178 Linden Dr. Bristol, VA 24202 United States

moreInfo.schedule:
Friday, Dec. 16
Practice Session: 11:30 to 2:30 p.m. (1/2 house redressed at 1:00 p.m.)

Pro-am: 3:00, 5:30 & 8:00p.m.


Saturday, Dec. 17
Roll call is 30 minutes prior to all squads.

A Squad- 8:30 am. - (twelve baker games)

B Squad- 2:30 pm. - (twelve baker games)

Advance top 16 teams (based on 48 team entries, may be adjusted.)

Sunday, Dec. 18
Roll call is 30 minutes prior to squad.
9:00 a.m. - Round Robin Baker match play 16-games (based on 16-team finals, may be adjusted.)

Top 4 Stepladder Baker Finals
moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
Entry Deadline
Online entries for members close at midnight on Monday, Dec. 12th, 2022.
Non-Member entries start - Tuesday, Dec 13th.
PBA Member/Non-Member entry cut off: Wednesday, Dec 14th, 12 NOON.

After the deadline, entries must be made directly with the PBA South Region Manager. Non-members please send me an email if you would like to enter the Event. I will call you back to confirm & process entry. Non-members will be confirmed on the Tuesday prior to the event start date on a space available basis.

This Event has missed the cutoff for 2022 RPI Event. Full PBA members will earn points in this event towards the $100,000 2023 PBA RPI event in Las Vegas, Nevada January 1-4, 2024. Must bowl 3 regional tournaments in the region that you have qualified in. RPI entrants must hold full PBA membership.

 FIELD SIZE LIMITED TO 72 TEAMSâ€¦. ENTRIES OPEN ONLINE: October 16, 2022
This will be an all Baker doubles format event with one player under the age of 50 and one player over the age of 50 signing up as a doubles team.

Eligibility
Participant must be a USBC Member in good standing. Non-Members must meet PBA average requirements.

After entering online please notify Tournament director to advise of your partners info.

Pattern: 39' Mike Aulby

moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
PBA Springfield Classic Prize Fund: $150,000

Tournament Host Center

Enterprise Park Lanes

1625 S. Enterprise Ave.

Springfield, MO 65804

(417) 883-0511

Eligibility

Participant must be a PBA member in good standing to enter unless bowling for a college. College players can enter any PBA Tour event, with the exception of the PBA Tournament of Champions and the PBA Players Championship, after entries close for PBA members and they have created their PBA account online. To enter, call John Weber at (314) 974-5399 or email [email protected].

Entries

PTQ entries open Monday, Nov. 21 and close Monday, Jan. 23 at 11 p.m. CT. All PBA members who are not classified as priority entrants (top 50 from the 2022 PBA Tour points list and all PBA Tour champions) will need to enter the PTQ. A minimum of eight players will advance to the elite field, with a maximum number to be determined to fill the elite field of 64. Example: If 50 point leaders and four more PBA Tour champions not among the top 50 2022 PBA Tour point leaders enter as priority entrants, 10 would advance from the PTQ, which would fill the elite field at 64.

Phone and mailed entries will not be accepted. Anyone needing instructions on how to enter online can contact membership services at (206) 332-9688.

Any entries received after the final entry deadline will incur a late fee.

Entry Fees

PBA PTQ Entries $250 (bowlers advancing from the PTQ will be charged an additional $250)

Oil Pattern

Viper 37

To enter, call John Weber at (314) 974-5399 or email [email protected].

Participants must stay at the Grand Casino Hotel & Resort in Shawnee, OK. The PBA room rate is $89/night and the code to receive the PBA rate is PBA Shawnee Classic. The confirmation number is required to enter the PBA Shawnee Classic. To make reservations call (405) 964-7777.

66

Point Values

Tier 2 Points

Priority Entries

Priority entries open Monday, Nov. 14 and will close Monday, Jan. 30 at 11 p.m. CT. Priority will be given in the following order:

  • PBA Tour Title Holders

PTQ entries open Monday, Nov. 21. All PBA members who are not classified as priority entrants will need to enter the PTQ. A minimum of eight players will advance to the elite field, with a maximum number to be determined to fill the elite field of 66. Example: If 50 point leaders and four more PBA Tour champions not among the top 50 2022 PBA Tour point leaders enter as priority entrants, 12 would advance from the PTQ, which would fill the elite field at 66.

Phone and mailed entries will not be accepted. Anyone needing instructions on how to enter online can contact membership services at (206) 332-9688.

Any entries received after the final entry deadline will incur a late fee.

hostCenter.address: 4800 Madison Avenue Sacramento, CA 95841 United States

moreInfo.schedule:
Saturday, March 4th, 2023

10:30 AM: Roll Call

11:00 AM: Qualifying Round #1 (All bowlers, 5 games) *McEwan Pattern*

Sunday, March 5th, 2023

8:30 AM: Roll Call

9:00 AM: Qualifying Round #2 (All bowlers, 5 games) *O'Neill Pattern*

Cut to top 8 bowlers in each division using the 10 game total pin fall

12:00 PM: Two-game Head to Head Elimination Match Play *O'Neill Pattern*

Top 8 bowlers in each division; 8 bowlers cut to 4 bowlers; 4 bowlers cut to 2 bowlers; final 2 bowlers cut to Champion
moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
Eligibility

PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments during the calendar year of 2023 are open to all male and female youth bowlers who have not yet reached the age of 18 as December 31, 2022. All participants must be USBC Youth Members.

Entry Fee

PBA Jr. Club Members: $99

Regular Entry Fee: $138

Entry Information

Entries close at midnight Wednesday, March 1st, 2023.

After the deadline, entries must be made directly with the PBA Regional Manager.

Format

All bowlers will bowl five (5) games in Qualifying Round #1 and five (5) games in Qualifying Round #2.

At the conclusion of the two Qualifying Rounds, all bowlerâ€™s total scores in each division will be pooled and the field will be cut to the top 8 bowlers in each division. In the event of a tie(s) for the final position, 9th-10th frame roll-off will take place immediately to break the tie. If the roll-off ends in a tie, all tied competitors for the alternate position will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner.

The top 8 bowlers in each division will advance to compete in a Two-Game Elimination Match Play bracket round. Seeding for the Two-Game Game Elimination Match Play will be determined by a bowlerâ€™s total pin fall from the two Qualifying Rounds. A standard 8-person bracket will be used. A bowler must win both games to advance in the bracket.

In the event of a tie during any Elimination Match Play match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

If each bowler wins one of the two games in the Elimination Match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

The remaining bowler after completion of the Two-Game Elimination Match Play will be declared the Tournament Champion.

Dress and Conduct Code (applies to Practice Session and all Competition)

All bowlers must wear shirts or jerseys with collars and sleeves and their name on the back. No t-shirts are allowed. Boys must wear slacks (no shorts). Girls must wear slacks, skirts, skorts or dress shorts. No jeans are allowed. Bowlers are not permitted to wear hats or other headgear, ripped or torn clothing, or basketball shorts. No clothing with offensive language or graphics, or any apparel which the tournament director feels is inappropriate. Smoking is not permitted by bowlers before, during or after the tournament. Proper behavior is expected at all times.

Oil Patterns

PBA oil patterns will be used for PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments. The oil pattern name and specs will be announced prior to the start of competition.
moreInfo.prizeFund:
PBA Jr. will be adding $1,000 in SMART scholarship funds to each PBA Jr. Regional event. The added $1,000 will be evenly dispersed to each division based on the number of entries. SMART Scholarships will be awarded in each division at a 1:6 ratio.

1st Place in the U18 Boys division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U18 Girls division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U15 Mixed division is projected to pay $1,000 First Place SMART scholarship with 50 entries

Eligibility

Participant must be a PBA member in good standing to enter unless bowling for a college. College players can enter any PBA Tour event, with the exception of the PBA Tournament of Champions and the PBA Players Championship, after entries close for PBA members and they have created their PBA account online. To enter, call John Weber at (314) 974-5399 or email [email protected].

Entries

PTQ entries open Monday, Nov. 21 and close Monday, March 6 at 11 p.m. CT. All PBA members who are not classified as priority entrants (top 50 from the 2022 PBA Tour points list and all PBA Tour champions) will need to enter the PTQ. A minimum of eight players will advance to the elite field, with a maximum number to be determined to fill the elite field of 64. Example: If 50 point leaders and four more PBA Tour champions not among the top 50 2022 PBA Tour point leaders enter as priority entrants, 10 would advance from the PTQ, which would fill the elite field at 64.

Phone and mailed entries will not be accepted. Anyone needing instructions on how to enter online can contact membership services at (206) 332-9688.

Sunday, April 30, 2023

9:00 AM: Qualifying Round #2 (All bowlers, 5 games)

Cut to top 8 bowlers in each division

11:00 AM: Two-game Elimination Match Play

Top 8 bowlers in each division; 8 bowlers cut to 4 bowlers; 4 bowlers cut to 2 bowlers; final 2 bowlers cut to Champion
moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
Eligibility

PBA Junior Regional Tournaments are open to all male and female youth bowlers who will not yet reach the age of 18 as of December 31, 2022. All participants must be USBC Youth Members.

Entry Fee

PBA Jr. Club Members: $99

Regular Entry Fee: $139

Entry Information

Entries close at midnight Wednesday April 26, 2023.

After the deadline, entries must be made directly with the PBA Regional Manager.

Format

All bowlers will bowl five (5) games in Qualifying Round #1 and five (5) games in Qualifying Round #2.

At the conclusion of the two Qualifying Rounds, all bowlerâ€™s total scores in each division will be pooled and the field will be cut to the top 8 bowlers in each division. In the event of a tie(s) for the final position, a one-game roll-off will take place immediately to break the tie. If a one (1) game roll-off ends in a tie, all tied competitors for the alternate position will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner.

The top 8 bowlers in each division will advance to compete in a Two-Game Elimination Match Play bracket round. Seeding for the Two-Game Game Elimination Match Play will be determined by a bowlerâ€™s total pinfall from the two Qualifying Rounds. A standard 8-person bracket will be used. A bowler must win both games to advance in the bracket.

In the event of a tie during any Elimination Match Play match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

If each bowler wins one of the two games in the Elimination Match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

The remaining bowler after completion of the Two-Game Elimination Match Play will be declared the Tournament Champion.

Dress and Conduct Code (applies to Practice Session and all Competition)

All bowlers must wear shirts or jerseys with collars and sleeves. These shirts or jerseys must be a name shirt with the whole name or last name embedded in the shirt (dye-sublimated shirts), embroidery or vinyl lettering at least 2â€ in height. No t-shirts are allowed. Boys must wear slacks (no shorts). Girls must wear slacks, skirts, skorts or dress shorts. Skirts/skorts & dress shorts may be worn in competition by female competitors. If a competitor's fingers are below the hemline (with arms hanging naturally), it is considered too short and not suitable. No jeans are allowed. Bowlers are not permitted to wear hats or other headgear, ripped or torn clothing, or basketball shorts. No clothing with offensive language or graphics, or any apparel which the tournament director feels is inappropriate. Smoking is not permitted by bowlers before, during or after the tournament. Proper behavior is expected at all times.

Oil Pattern

A PBA JR oil pattern will be used for PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments. For this Event, the PBA JR. 41' Danielle McEwan Pattern will be used.
moreInfo.prizeFund:
PBA Jr. will be adding $1,000 in SMART scholarship funds to each PBA Jr. Regional event. The added $1,000 will be evenly dispersed to each division based on the number of entries. SMART Scholarships will be awarded in each division at a 1:6 ratio.

1st Place in the U18 Boys division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U18 Girls division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U15 Mixed division is projected to pay $1,000 First Place SMART scholarship with 50 entries

Beginning August 1, 2020, the use of a balance hole is prohibited. moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
Eligibility

PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments during the calendar year of 2023 are open to all male and female youth bowlers who have not yet reached the age of 18 as December 31, 2022. All participants must be USBC Youth Members.

Entry Fee

PBA Jr. Club Members: $99

Regular Entry Fee: $138

Entry Information

Entries close at midnight Wednesday, May 24, 2023.

After the deadline, entries must be made directly with the PBA Regional Manager.

Format

All bowlers will bowl five (5) games in Qualifying Round #1 and five (5) games in Qualifying Round #2.

At the conclusion of the two Qualifying Rounds, all bowlerâ€™s total scores in each division will be pooled and the field will be cut to the Top 8 bowlers in each division. In the event of a tie(s) for the final position, a one-game roll-off will take place immediately to break the tie. If a one (1) game roll-off ends in a tie, all tied competitors for the alternate position will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner.

The Top 8 bowlers in each division will advance to compete in a Two-Game Elimination Match Play bracket round. Seeding for the Two-Game Game Elimination Match Play will be determined by a bowlerâ€™s total pinfall from the two Qualifying Rounds. A standard 8-person bracket will be used. A bowler must win both games to advance in the bracket.

In the event of a tie during any Elimination Match Play match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

If each bowler wins one of the two games in the Elimination Match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

The remaining bowler after completion of the Two-Game Elimination Match Play will be declared the Tournament Champion.

Dress and Conduct Code (applies to Practice Session and all Competition)

All bowlers must wear shirts or jerseys with collars and sleeves and their name on the back. No t-shirts are allowed. Boys must wear slacks (no shorts). Girls must wear slacks, skirts, skorts or dress shorts. If a competitor's fingers are below the hemline (with arms hanging naturally), the skirt is considered too short and not suitable. No jeans are allowed. Bowlers are not permitted to wear hats or other headgear, ripped or torn clothing, or basketball shorts. No clothing with offensive language or graphics, or any apparel which the tournament director feels is inappropriate. Smoking is not permitted by bowlers before, during or after the tournament. Proper behavior is expected at all times.

Oil Pattern

A PBA JR oil pattern will be used for PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments. For this Event, the PBA JR. 44' E.J. Tackett Pattern will be used.

moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
Eligibility

PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments during the calendar year of 2023 are open to all male and female youth bowlers who have not yet reached the age of 18 as December 31, 2022. All participants must be USBC Youth Members.

Entry Fee

PBA Jr. Club Members: $99

Regular Entry Fee: $138

Entry Information

Entries close at midnight Wednesday, May 29th, 2023.

After the deadline, entries must be made directly with the PBA Regional Manager.

Format

All bowlers will bowl five (5) games in Qualifying Round #1 and five (5) games in Qualifying Round #2.

At the conclusion of the two Qualifying Rounds, all bowlerâ€™s total scores in each division will be pooled and the field will be cut to the top 8 bowlers in each division. In the event of a tie(s) for the final position, a one-game roll-off will take place immediately to break the tie. If a one (1) game roll-off ends in a tie, all tied competitors for the alternate position will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner.

The top 8 bowlers in each division will advance to compete in a Two-Game Elimination Match Play bracket round. Seeding for the Two-Game Game Elimination Match Play will be determined by a bowlerâ€™s total pinfall from the two Qualifying Rounds. A standard 8-person bracket will be used. A bowler must win both games to advance in the bracket.

In the event of a tie during any Elimination Match Play match, competitors will compete in a 9th-10th frame roll-off. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. 

The remaining bowler after completion of the Two-Game Elimination Match Play will be declared the Tournament Champion.

Dress and Conduct Code (applies to Practice Session and all Competition)

All bowlers must wear shirts or jerseys with collars and sleeves and their name on the back. No t-shirts are allowed. Boys must wear slacks (no shorts). Girls must wear slacks, skirts, skorts or dress shorts. No jeans are allowed. Bowlers are not permitted to wear hats or other headgear, ripped or torn clothing, or basketball shorts. No clothing with offensive language or graphics, or any apparel which the tournament director feels is inappropriate. Smoking is not permitted by bowlers before, during or after the tournament. Proper behavior is expected at all times.

Oil Patterns

A PBA oil pattern will be used for PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments. The oil pattern name and specs will be announced prior to the start of competition.
moreInfo.prizeFund:
PBA Jr. will be adding $1,000 in SMART scholarship funds to each PBA Jr. Regional event. The added $1,000 will be evenly dispersed to each division based on the number of entries. SMART Scholarships will be awarded in each division at a 1:6 ratio.

1st Place in the U18 Boys division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U18 Girls division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U15 Mixed division is projected to pay $1,000 First Place SMART scholarship with 50 entries

moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
Eligibility

PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments during the calendar year of 2023 are open to all male and female youth bowlers who have not yet reached the age of 18 as December 31, 2022. All participants must be USBC Youth Members.

Entry Fee

PBA Jr. Club Members: $99

Regular Entry Fee: $138

Entry Information

Entries close at midnight Wednesday, June 7, 2023.

After the deadline, entries must be made directly with the PBA Regional Manager.

Format

All bowlers will bowl five (5) games in Qualifying Round #1 and five (5) games in Qualifying Round #2.

At the conclusion of the two Qualifying Rounds, all bowlerâ€™s total scores in each division will be pooled and the field will be cut to the top 8 bowlers in each division. In the event of a tie(s) for the final position, a one-game roll-off will take place immediately to break the tie. If a one (1) game roll-off ends in a tie, all tied competitors for the alternate position will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner.

The top 8 bowlers in each division will advance to compete in a Two-Game Elimination Match Play bracket round. Seeding for the Two-Game Game Elimination Match Play will be determined by a bowlerâ€™s total pinfall from the two Qualifying Rounds. A standard 8-person bracket will be used. A bowler must win both games to advance in the bracket.

In the event of a tie during any Elimination Match Play match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

If each bowler wins one of the two games in the Elimination Match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

The remaining bowler after completion of the Two-Game Elimination Match Play will be declared the Tournament Champion.

Dress and Conduct Code (applies to Practice Session and all Competition)

All bowlers must wear shirts or jerseys with collars and sleeves and their name on the back. No t-shirts are allowed. Boys must wear slacks (no shorts). Girls must wear slacks, skirts, skorts or dress shorts. If a competitor's fingers are below the hemline (with arms hanging naturally), the skirt is considered too short and not suitable. No jeans are allowed. Bowlers are not permitted to wear hats or other headgear, ripped or torn clothing, or basketball shorts. No clothing with offensive language or graphics, or any apparel which the tournament director feels is inappropriate. Smoking is not permitted by bowlers before, during or after the tournament. Proper behavior is expected at all times.

Oil Pattern

A PBA JR oil pattern will be used for PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments. For this Event, the PBA JR. 36' Bill O'Neill Pattern will be used.

Host Hotel

Home2 Suites by Hilton Charlotte Mooresville - 209 Medical Park Road, Mooresville, NC 28117  - View your attendee website

moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
Eligibility

PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments during the calendar year of 2023 are open to all male and female youth bowlers who have not yet reached the age of 18 as December 31, 2022. All participants must be USBC Youth Members.

Entry Fee

PBA Jr. Club Members: $99

Regular Entry Fee: $138

Entry Information

Entries close at midnight Wednesday, June 23, 2023.

After the deadline, entries must be made directly with the PBA Regional Manager.

Hotel Information

Hilton Garden Inn, 1787-B Airport Rd., Allentown, PA 18109.  Special Rate for PBA Jr event $169 + tax.  Must make reservation no later than June 9, 2023.

Use this link to make your reservation  http://www.hilton.com/en/attend-my-event/pbajunioreastregionaltournament

Format

All bowlers will bowl five (5) games in Qualifying Round #1 and five (5) games in Qualifying Round #2.

At the conclusion of the two Qualifying Rounds, all bowlerâ€™s total scores in each division will be pooled and the field will be cut to the top 8 bowlers in each division. In the event of a tie(s) for the final position, a one-game roll-off will take place immediately to break the tie. If a one (1) game roll-off ends in a tie, all tied competitors for the alternate position will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner.

The top 8 bowlers in each division will advance to compete in a Two-Game Elimination Match Play bracket round. Seeding for the Two-Game Game Elimination Match Play will be determined by a bowlerâ€™s total pinfall from the two Qualifying Rounds. A standard 8-person bracket will be used. A bowler must win both games to advance in the bracket.

In the event of a tie during any Elimination Match Play match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

If each bowler wins one of the two games in the Elimination Match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

The remaining bowler after completion of the Two-Game Elimination Match Play will be declared the Tournament Champion.

Dress and Conduct Code (applies to Practice Session and all Competition)

All bowlers must wear shirts or jerseys with collars and sleeves and their name on the back. No t-shirts are allowed. Boys must wear slacks (no shorts). Girls must wear slacks, skirts, skorts or dress shorts. No jeans are allowed. Bowlers are not permitted to wear hats or other headgear, ripped or torn clothing, or basketball shorts. No clothing with offensive language or graphics, or any apparel which the tournament director feels is inappropriate. Smoking is not permitted by bowlers before, during or after the tournament. Proper behavior is expected at all times.

Oil Patterns

A PBA oil pattern will be used for PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments. The oil pattern name and specs will be announced prior to the start of competition.

1st Place in the U18 Girls division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

Sunday, July 2, 2023

8:30 AM: Roll Call

9:00 AM: Qualifying Round #2 (All bowlers, 5 games)

Cut to top 8 bowlers in each division

11:00 AM: Two-game Elimination Match Play

Top 8 bowlers in each division; 8 bowlers cut to 4 bowlers; 4 bowlers cut to 2 bowlers; final 2 bowlers cut to Champion
moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
Eligibility

PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments during the calendar year of 2023 are open to all male and female youth bowlers who have not yet reached the age of 18 as December 31, 2022. All participants must be USBC Youth Members.

Entry Fee

PBA Jr. Club Members: $99

Regular Entry Fee: $138

Entry Information

Entries close at midnight Wednesday, June 28, 2023.

After the deadline, entries must be made directly with the PBA Regional Manager.

Format

All bowlers will bowl five (5) games in Qualifying Round #1 and five (5) games in Qualifying Round #2.

At the conclusion of the two Qualifying Rounds, all bowlerâ€™s total scores in each division will be pooled and the field will be cut to the top 8 bowlers in each division. In the event of a tie(s) for the final position, a one-game roll-off will take place immediately to break the tie. If a one (1) game roll-off ends in a tie, all tied competitors for the alternate position will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner.

The top 8 bowlers in each division will advance to compete in a Two-Game Elimination Match Play bracket round. Seeding for the Two-Game Game Elimination Match Play will be determined by a bowlerâ€™s total pinfall from the two Qualifying Rounds. A standard 8-person bracket will be used. A bowler must win both games to advance in the bracket.

In the event of a tie during any Elimination Match Play match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

If each bowler wins one of the two games in the Elimination Match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

The remaining bowler after completion of the Two-Game Elimination Match Play will be declared the Tournament Champion.

Dress and Conduct Code (applies to Practice Session and all Competition)

All bowlers must wear shirts or jerseys with collars and sleeves and their name on the back. No t-shirts are allowed. Boys must wear slacks (no shorts). Girls must wear slacks, skirts, skorts or dress shorts. No jeans are allowed. Bowlers are not permitted to wear hats or other headgear, ripped or torn clothing, or basketball shorts. No clothing with offensive language or graphics, or any apparel which the tournament director feels is inappropriate. Smoking is not permitted by bowlers before, during or after the tournament. Proper behavior is expected at all times.

Oil Patterns

A PBA oil pattern will be used for PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments. The oil pattern name and specs will be announced prior to the start of competition.
moreInfo.prizeFund:
PBA Jr. will be adding $1,000 in SMART scholarship funds to each PBA Jr. Regional event. The added $1,000 will be evenly dispersed to each division based on the number of entries. SMART Scholarships will be awarded in each division at a 1:6 ratio.

1st Place in the U18 Boys division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U18 Girls division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U15 Mixed division is projected to pay $1,000 First Place SMART scholarship with 50 entries

A complete list of product registered companies can be found here.

Beginning August 1, 2020, the use of a balance hole is prohibited. Eligibility

Participant must be a USBC Member in good standing and have reached their 50th birthday prior to the tournament start date. Non members must meet PBA average requirements.

RPI
This event is a Central and Midwest Region event and will count for points in both regions. Only Full PBA Members will be able to qualify for the year end RPI in Las Vegas, Nevada. To qualify for the RPI, you must bowl in 3 events within the region in the calendar year.

Host

PBA Member Billy Froberg

Pattern

PBA Petraglia 46

1:3

100 (subject to change)

Online entries for members and non-members close at midnight on Monday, July 10th.

After the deadline, entries must be made directly with the PBA Central Region Manager.

moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
Field Capacity

48 Teams

Eligibility

Participant must be a USBC Member in good standing. Non members must meet the PBA minimum average requirements of 200.

Teams must consist of one PBA Member and one Non PBA Member.

Host(s)

Dave and Michelle Husted

RPI

This event is a Northwest Region event and will only count for points in the Northwest Region. Only Full PBA Members will be able to qualify for the year end RPI in Las Vegas, Nevada.

Payout Ratio

1:3

Entry Fee

PBA Members: $245

Non-Members: $310 (Credit Card or Cash only)

Balance Holes
Beginning August 1, 2020, the use of a balance hole is prohibited. The rule states all holes in a bowling ball must be used on every delivery; any hole not used is considered a balance hole, making the ball illegal. Bowlers who do not use their thumb no longer can have a thumb hole, as it now is considered a balance hole. They also need to mark their ball to show where they place their palm on delivery.

Product Registration
A complete list of 2023 Product Registered companies, can be found here.

Entry Deadline

Online entries for members and non-members close at midnight on Wednesday, July 12th, 2023.

After the deadline, entries must be made directly with the PBA Northwest/West Region Manager.

moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
Eligibility

PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments during the calendar year of 2023 are open to all male and female youth bowlers who have not yet reached the age of 18 as December 31, 2022. All participants must be USBC Youth Members.

Entry Fee

PBA Jr. Club Members: $99

Regular Entry Fee: $138

Entry Information

Entries close at midnight Wednesday, July 26, 2023.

After the deadline, entries must be made directly with the PBA Regional Manager.

Format

All bowlers will bowl five (5) games in Qualifying Round #1 and five (5) games in Qualifying Round #2.

At the conclusion of the two Qualifying Rounds, all bowlerâ€™s total scores in each division will be pooled and the field will be cut to the top 8 bowlers in each division. In the event of a tie(s) for the final position, a one-game roll-off will take place immediately to break the tie. If a one (1) game roll-off ends in a tie, all tied competitors for the alternate position will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner.

The top 8 bowlers in each division will advance to compete in a Two-Game Elimination Match Play bracket round. Seeding for the Two-Game Game Elimination Match Play will be determined by a bowlerâ€™s total pinfall from the two Qualifying Rounds. A standard 8-person bracket will be used. A bowler must win both games to advance in the bracket.

In the event of a tie during any Elimination Match Play match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

If each bowler wins one of the two games in the Elimination Match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

The remaining bowler after completion of the Two-Game Elimination Match Play will be declared the Tournament Champion.

Dress and Conduct Code (applies to Practice Session and all Competition)

All bowlers must wear shirts or jerseys with collars and sleeves and their name on the back. No t-shirts are allowed. Boys must wear slacks (no shorts). Girls must wear slacks, skirts, skorts or dress shorts. If a competitor's fingers are below the hemline (with arms hanging naturally), the skirt is considered too short and not suitable. No jeans are allowed. Bowlers are not permitted to wear hats or other headgear, ripped or torn clothing, or basketball shorts. No clothing with offensive language or graphics, or any apparel which the tournament director feels is inappropriate. Smoking is not permitted by bowlers before, during or after the tournament. Proper behavior is expected at all times.

Oil Patterns

A PBA oil pattern will be used for PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments. The 2023 44' E.J. Tackett Pattern is being used in this Event.

1st Place in the U18 Girls division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
Entry Fee (credit or debit card only)

Regular Entry Fee: $179

PBA Jr. Club Members: $129

Full Tournament Format & Rules

To view the Info Sheet that includes the full tournament format and rules for this event, please click here.

Entry Information

Entries close at midnight Wednesday, August 9, 2023 or when the maximum number of entries has been reached, whichever comes first. In the event the maximum number of entries is reached prior to the deadline, bowlers can be placed on a waiting list.

Eligibility

Open to all junior bowlers who have not yet reached the age of 18 by December 31, 2022.

Dress & Conduct Code (Applies to Practice Session and all Competition)

All bowlers must wear shirts or jerseys with collars and sleeves and their name on the back, at least 2' in height. No t-shirts are allowed. Boys must wear slacks (no shorts). Girls must wear slacks, skirts, skorts or dress shorts. If a competitor's fingers are below the hemline (with arms hanging naturally), the skirt/skort is considered too short and not suitable. No jeans are allowed. Bowlers are not permitted to wear hats or other headgear, ripped or torn clothing, or basketball shorts. No clothing with offensive language or graphics, or any apparel which the tournament director feels is inappropriate. 

Smoking is not permitted by bowlers before, during or after the tournament. Proper behavior is expected at all times.

Oil Patterns

Three PBA Jr. oil patterns will be used for the PBA Jr. Regional Qualifiers. Each 5-game block will be bowed on a different PBA Jr. oil pattern: PBA Jr. Oâ€™Neill / 36-feet; PBA Jr. McEwan / 41-feet; PBA Jr. Tackett / 44-feet. The Oâ€™Neill 36-foot pattern will be used in the Elimination Bracket round.

Bowling Balls

All bowling balls used during this tournament must be USBC approved and officially cleared by the PBA.

Bowlers may use an unlimited number of bowling balls during the tournament, but all balls must be logged on their scorecard.

Product Registration

A complete list of PBA Product Registered companies, can be found here.
moreInfo.prizeFund: SMART funds totaling 400 points will be added to each Division. SMART Scholarships will be awarded to all bowlers who advance to the Elimination Bracket Round in each division, or at a 1:6 ratio, whichever is more favorable based on the total number of entries.

moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
Entry Fee (credit or debit card only)

Regular Entry Fee: $179

PBA Jr. Club Members: $129

Full Tournament Format & Rules

To view the Info Sheet that includes the full tournament format and rules for this event, please click here.

Entry Information

Entries close at midnight Wednesday, August 9, 2023 or when the maximum number of entries has been reached, whichever comes first. In the event the maximum number of entries is reached prior to the deadline, bowlers can be placed on a waiting list.

Eligibility

Open to all junior bowlers who have not yet reached the age of 18 by December 31, 2022.

Dress & Conduct Code (Applies to Practice Session and all Competition)

Boys must wear slacks (no shorts). Girls must wear slacks, skirts, skorts or dress shorts. No jeans are allowed. Bowlers are not permitted to wear hats or other headgear, ripped or torn clothing, or basketball shorts. No clothing with offensive language or graphics, or any apparel which the tournament director feels is inappropriate.

All bowlers must wear shirts or jerseys with collars and sleeves. No t-shirts are allowed.

Smoking is not permitted by bowlers before, during or after the tournament. Proper behavior is expected at all times.

Oil Patterns

Three PBA Jr. oil patterns will be used for the PBA Jr. Regional Qualifiers. Each 5-game block will be bowed on a different PBA Jr. oil pattern: PBA Jr. Oâ€™Neill / 36-feet; PBA Jr. McEwan / 41-feet; PBA Jr. Tackett / 44-feet. The Oâ€™Neill 36-foot pattern will be used in the Elimination Bracket round.

Bowling Balls

All bowling balls used during this tournament must be USBC approved and officially cleared by the PBA.

Bowlers may use an unlimited number of bowling balls during the tournament, but all balls must be logged on their scorecard.

A complete list of PBA Product Registered companies, can be found here.

moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
Eligibility

PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments during the calendar year of 2023 are open to all male and female youth bowlers who have not yet reached the age of 18 as December 31, 2022. All participants must be USBC Youth Members.

Entry Fee

PBA Jr. Club Members: $99

Regular Entry Fee: $138

Entry Information

Entries close at midnight Wednesday, August 30, 2023.

After the deadline, entries must be made directly with the PBA Regional Director.

Format

All bowlers will bowl five (5) games in Qualifying Round #1 and five (5) games in Qualifying Round #2.

At the conclusion of the two (2) Qualifying Rounds, all bowlerâ€™s total scores in each division will be pooled and the field will be cut to the top 8 bowlers in each division. In the event of a tie(s) for the final position, a one-game roll-off will take place immediately to break the tie. If a one (1) game roll-off ends in a tie, all tied competitors for the final position will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the match play advancer.

The top 8 bowlers in each division will advance to compete in a Two-Game Elimination Match Play bracket round. Seeding for the Two-Game Game Elimination Match Play will be determined by a bowlerâ€™s total pinfall from the two Qualifying Rounds. A standard 8-person bracket will be used. A bowler must win both games to advance in the bracket.

In the event of a tie during any Elimination Match Play match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

The remaining bowler after completion of the Two-Game Elimination Match Play will be declared the Tournament Champion.

Dress and Conduct Code (applies to Practice Session and all Competition)

All bowlers must wear shirts or jerseys with collars and sleeves and their name on the back. No t-shirts are allowed. Boys must wear slacks (no shorts). Girls must wear slacks, skirts, skorts or dress shorts. No jeans are allowed. Bowlers are not permitted to wear hats or other headgear, ripped or torn clothing, or basketball shorts. No clothing with offensive language or graphics, or any apparel which the tournament director feels is inappropriate. Smoking is not permitted by bowlers before, during or after the tournament. Proper behavior is expected at all times.

Oil Patterns

A PBA oil pattern will be used for PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments. The oil pattern name and specs will be announced prior to the start of competition.
moreInfo.prizeFund:
PBA Jr. will be adding $1,000 in SMART scholarship funds to each PBA Jr. Regional event. The added $1,000 will be evenly dispersed to each division based on the number of entries. SMART Scholarships will be awarded in each division at a 1:6 ratio.

1st Place in the U18 Boys division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U18 Girls division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U15 Mixed division is projected to pay $1,000 First Place SMART scholarship with 50 entries

Product Registration

A complete list of 2023 Product Registered companies can be found here.

9:00 AM: Qualifying Round #2 (All bowlers, 5 games)

Cut to top 8 bowlers in each division

11:00 AM: Two-game Elimination Match Play

Top 8 bowlers in each division; 8 bowlers cut to 4 bowlers; 4 bowlers cut to 2 bowlers; final 2 bowlers cut to Champion
moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
Eligibility

PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments during the calendar year of 2023 are open to all male and female youth bowlers who have not yet reached the age of 18 as December 31, 2022. All participants must be USBC Youth Members.

Entry Fee

PBA Jr. Club Members: $99

Regular Entry Fee: $138

Entry Information

Entries close at midnight Wednesday, September 27, 2023.

After the deadline, entries must be made directly with the PBA Regional Manager.

Format

All bowlers will bowl five (5) games in Qualifying Round #1 and five (5) games in Qualifying Round #2.

At the conclusion of the two Qualifying Rounds, all bowlerâ€™s total scores in each division will be pooled and the field will be cut to the top 8 bowlers in each division. In the event of a tie(s) for the final position, a one-game roll-off will take place immediately to break the tie. If a one (1) game roll-off ends in a tie, all tied competitors for the alternate position will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner.

The top 8 bowlers in each division will advance to compete in a Two-Game Elimination Match Play bracket round. Seeding for the Two-Game Game Elimination Match Play will be determined by a bowlerâ€™s total pinfall from the two Qualifying Rounds. A standard 8-person bracket will be used. A bowler must win both games to advance in the bracket.

In the event of a tie during any Elimination Match Play match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

If each bowler wins one of the two games in the Elimination Match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

The remaining bowler after completion of the Two-Game Elimination Match Play will be declared the Tournament Champion.

Dress and Conduct Code (applies to Practice Session and all Competition)

All bowlers must wear shirts or jerseys with collars and sleeves and their name on the back. No t-shirts are allowed. Boys must wear slacks (no shorts). Girls must wear slacks, skirts, skorts or dress shorts. No jeans are allowed. Bowlers are not permitted to wear hats or other headgear, ripped or torn clothing, or basketball shorts. No clothing with offensive language or graphics, or any apparel which the tournament director feels is inappropriate. Smoking is not permitted by bowlers before, during or after the tournament. Proper behavior is expected at all times.

Oil Patterns

A PBA oil pattern will be used for PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments. The oil pattern name and specs will be announced prior to the start of competition.
moreInfo.prizeFund:
PBA Jr. will be adding $1,000 in SMART scholarship funds to each PBA Jr. Regional event. The added $1,000 will be evenly dispersed to each division based on the number of entries. SMART Scholarships will be awarded in each division at a 1:6 ratio.

1st Place in the U18 Boys division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U18 Girls division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U15 Mixed division is projected to pay $1,000 First Place SMART scholarship with 50 entries

Sunday, October 8th, 2023

11:00 AM: Two-game Elimination Match Play

Top 8 bowlers in each division; 8 bowlers cut to 4 bowlers; 4 bowlers cut to 2 bowlers; final 2 bowlers cut to Champion
moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
Eligibility

PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments during the calendar year of 2023 are open to all male and female youth bowlers who have not yet reached the age of 18 as December 31, 2022. All participants must be USBC Youth Members.

Entry Fee

PBA Jr. Club Members: $99

Regular Entry Fee: $138

Entry Information

Entries close at midnight Wednesday, October 4th, 2023.

After the deadline, entries must be made directly with the PBA Regional Manager.

Format

All bowlers will bowl five (5) games in Qualifying Round #1 and five (5) games in Qualifying Round #2.

At the conclusion of the two Qualifying Rounds, all bowlerâ€™s total scores in each division will be pooled and the field will be cut to the top 8 bowlers in each division. In the event of a tie(s) for the final position, a one-game roll-off will take place immediately to break the tie. If a one (1) game roll-off ends in a tie, all tied competitors for the alternate position will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner.

The top 8 bowlers in each division will advance to compete in a Two-Game Elimination Match Play bracket round. Seeding for the Two-Game Game Elimination Match Play will be determined by a bowlerâ€™s total pinfall from the two Qualifying Rounds. A standard 8-person bracket will be used. A bowler must win both games to advance in the bracket.

In the event of a tie during any Elimination Match Play match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

If each bowler wins one of the two games in the Elimination Match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

The remaining bowler after completion of the Two-Game Elimination Match Play will be declared the Tournament Champion.

Dress and Conduct Code (applies to Practice Session and all Competition)

All bowlers must wear shirts or jerseys with collars and sleeves and their name on the back. No t-shirts are allowed. Boys must wear slacks (no shorts). Girls must wear slacks, skirts, skorts or dress shorts. No jeans are allowed. Bowlers are not permitted to wear hats or other headgear, ripped or torn clothing, or basketball shorts. No clothing with offensive language or graphics, or any apparel which the tournament director feels is inappropriate. Smoking is not permitted by bowlers before, during or after the tournament. Proper behavior is expected at all times.

Oil Patterns

A PBA oil pattern will be used for PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments. The oil pattern name and specs will be announced prior to the start of competition.
moreInfo.prizeFund:
PBA Jr. will be adding $1,000 in SMART scholarship funds to each PBA Jr. Regional event. The added $1,000 will be evenly dispersed to each division based on the number of entries. SMART Scholarships will be awarded in each division at a 1:6 ratio.

1st Place in the U18 Boys division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U18 Girls division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U15 Mixed division is projected to pay $1,000 First Place SMART scholarship with 50 entries

moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
Eligibility

PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments during the calendar year of 2023 are open to all male and female youth bowlers who have not yet reached the age of 18 as December 31, 2022. All participants must be USBC Youth Members.

Entry Fee

PBA Jr. Club Members: $99

Regular Entry Fee: $138

Entry Information

Entries close at midnight Wednesday, October 25, 2023.

After the deadline, entries must be made directly with the PBA Regional Manager.

Format

All bowlers will bowl five (5) games in Qualifying Round #1 and five (5) games in Qualifying Round #2.

At the conclusion of the two Qualifying Rounds, all bowlerâ€™s total scores in each division will be pooled and the field will be cut to the top 8 bowlers in each division. In the event of a tie(s) for the final position, a one-game roll-off will take place immediately to break the tie. If a one (1) game roll-off ends in a tie, all tied competitors for the alternate position will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner.

The top 8 bowlers in each division will advance to compete in a Two-Game Elimination Match Play bracket round. Seeding for the Two-Game Game Elimination Match Play will be determined by a bowlerâ€™s total pinfall from the two Qualifying Rounds. A standard 8-person bracket will be used. A bowler must win both games to advance in the bracket.

In the event of a tie during any Elimination Match Play match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

If each bowler wins one of the two games in the Elimination Match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

The remaining bowler after completion of the Two-Game Elimination Match Play will be declared the Tournament Champion.

Dress and Conduct Code (applies to Practice Session and all Competition)

All bowlers must wear shirts or jerseys with collars and sleeves and their name on the back. No t-shirts are allowed. Boys must wear slacks (no shorts). Girls must wear slacks, skirts, skorts or dress shorts. No jeans are allowed. Bowlers are not permitted to wear hats or other headgear, ripped or torn clothing, or basketball shorts. No clothing with offensive language or graphics, or any apparel which the tournament director feels is inappropriate. Smoking is not permitted by bowlers before, during or after the tournament. Proper behavior is expected at all times.

Oil Patterns

A PBA oil pattern will be used for PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments. The oil pattern name and specs will be announced prior to the start of competition.
moreInfo.prizeFund:
PBA Jr. will be adding $1,000 in SMART scholarship funds to each PBA Jr. Regional event. The added $1,000 will be evenly dispersed to each division based on the number of entries. SMART Scholarships will be awarded in each division at a 1:6 ratio.

1st Place in the U18 Boys division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U18 Girls division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U15 Mixed division is projected to pay $1,000 First Place SMART scholarship with 50 entries

Beginning August 1, 2020, the use of a balance hole is prohibited. hostCenter.address: 80 Newport Ave. East Providence, RI 02916 United States

moreInfo.schedule:
Friday, December 1, 2023

Saturday, December 2, 2023

9:30 AM: Roll Call

10:00 AM: Qualifying Round #1 (All bowlers, 5 games)

Sunday, December 3, 2023

8:30 AM: Roll Call

9:00 AM: Qualifying Round #2 (All bowlers, 5 games)

Cut to top 8 bowlers in each division

11:00 AM: Two-game Elimination Match Play

Top 8 bowlers in each division; 8 bowlers cut to 4 bowlers; 4 bowlers cut to 2 bowlers; final 2 bowlers cut to Champion
moreInfo.tournamentNotes:
Eligibility

PBA Junior Regional Tournaments are open to all male and female youth bowlers who will not yet reach the age of 18 as of August 1, 2023. All participants must be USBC Youth Members.

Entry Fee

PBA Jr. Club Members: $99

Regular Entry Fee: $138

Entry Information

Entries close at midnight Wednesday, November 29, 2023.

After the deadline, entries must be made directly with the PBA Regional Manager.

Format

All bowlers will bowl five (5) games in Qualifying Round #1 and five (5) games in Qualifying Round #2.

At the conclusion of the two Qualifying Rounds, all bowlerâ€™s total scores in each division will be pooled and the field will be cut to the top 8 bowlers in each division. In the event of a tie(s) for the final position, a one-game roll-off will take place immediately to break the tie. If a one (1) game roll-off ends in a tie, all tied competitors for the alternate position will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner.

The top 8 bowlers in each division will advance to compete in a Two-Game Elimination Match Play bracket round. Seeding for the Two-Game Game Elimination Match Play will be determined by a bowlerâ€™s total pinfall from the two Qualifying Rounds. A standard 8-person bracket will be used. A bowler must win both games to advance in the bracket.

In the event of a tie during any Elimination Match Play match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

If each bowler wins one of the two games in the Elimination Match, competitors will compete in a one (1) ball sudden death roll-off to determine the winner. The highest seeded competitor shall determine starting lane and order for the roll-off. The competitors will alternate lanes in the same bowling order until the tie is broken.

The remaining bowler after completion of the Two-Game Elimination Match Play will be declared the Tournament Champion.

Dress and Conduct Code (applies to Practice Session and all Competition)

All bowlers must wear shirts or jerseys with collars and sleeves and their name on the back. No t-shirts are allowed. Boys must wear slacks (no shorts). Girls must wear slacks, skirts, skorts or dress shorts. No jeans are allowed. Bowlers are not permitted to wear hats or other headgear, ripped or torn clothing, or basketball shorts. No clothing with offensive language or graphics, or any apparel which the tournament director feels is inappropriate. Smoking is not permitted by bowlers before, during or after the tournament. Proper behavior is expected at all times.

Oil Patterns

A PBA oil pattern will be used for PBA Jr. Regional Tournaments. The oil pattern name and specs will be announced prior to the start of competition.
moreInfo.prizeFund:
PBA Jr. will be adding $1,000 in SMART scholarship funds to each PBA Jr. Regional event. The added $1,000 will be evenly dispersed to each division based on the number of entries. SMART Scholarships will be awarded in each division at a 1:6 ratio.

1st Place in the U18 Boys division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U18 Girls division is projected to pay $1,750 First Place SMART scholarship with 75 entries

1st Place in the U15 Mixed division is projected to pay $1,000 First Place SMART scholarship with 50 entries
